intro: Bupleurum rigidum var. petiolare, commonly known as the rigid bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, often hairy stems that are somewhat rigid. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale blue, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often have petioles, giving it its specific variety name. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassy areas.
